verses.verse: (One Kingdom, One King) Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

“As for you, son of man, (Num. 17:2, 3) take a stick for yourself and write on it: ‘For Judah and for (2 Chr. 11:12, 13, 16; 15:9; 30:11, 18) the children of Israel, his companions.’ Then take another stick and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel, his companions.’
Then (Is. 11:13; Jer. 50:4; Ezek. 37:22-24; Hos. 1:11; Zeph. 3:9) join them one to another for yourself into one stick, and they will become one in your hand.
“And when the children of your people speak to you, saying, (Ezek. 12:9; 24:19) ‘Will you not show us what you mean by these?’—

(Zech. 10:6) say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I will take (Ezek. 37:16, 17) the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, his companions; and I will join them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in My hand.” ’
And the sticks on which you write will be in your hand (Ezek. 12:3) before their eyes.

“Then say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely (Is. 43:5, 6; Jer. 32:37; Ezek. 36:24; Amos 9:14, 15) I will take the children of Israel from among the nations, wherever they have gone, and will gather them from every side and bring them into their own land;

and (Is. 11:13; Jer. 3:18; Hos. 1:11) I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and (Ezek. 34:23; John 10:16) one king shall be king over them all; they shall no longer be two nations, nor shall they ever be divided into two kingdoms again.

(Ezek. 36:25) They shall not defile themselves anymore with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but (Ezek. 36:28, 29) I will deliver them from all their dwelling places in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. Then they shall be My people, and I will be their God.

(Is. 40:11; (Jer. 23:5; 30:9); Ezek. 34:23, 24; Hos. 3:5; (Luke 1:32)) “David My servant shall be king over them, and ((John 10:16)) they shall all have one shepherd; (Ezek. 36:27) they shall also walk in My judgments and observe My statutes, and do them.

(Ezek. 36:28) Then they shall dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob My servant, where your fathers dwelt; and they shall dwell there, they, their children, and their children’s children, (Is. 60:21; Joel 3:20; Amos 9:15) forever; and (Ps. 89:3, 4; John 12:34) My servant David shall be their prince forever.

Moreover I will make (Ps. 89:3; Is. 55:3; (Jer. 32:40)) a covenant of peace with them, and it shall be an everlasting covenant with them; I will establish them and (Jer. 30:19; Ezek. 36:10) multiply them, and I will set My ((2 Cor. 6:16)) sanctuary in their midst forevermore.
(Lev. 26:11; (John 1:14); Rev. 21:3) My tabernacle also shall be with them; indeed I will be (Ezek. 11:20) their God, and they shall be My people.
(Ezek. 36:23) The nations also will know that I, the LORD, (Ex. 31:13; Ezek. 20:12) sanctify Israel, when My sanctuary is in their midst forevermore.” ’ ”
(Gog and Allies Attack Israel) Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

(Ezek. 39:1) “Son of man, (Ezek. 35:2, 3) set your face against (Ezek. 38:1—39:24; Rev. 20:8) Gog, of the land of (Gen. 10:2; Ezek. 39:6; Rev. 20:8) Magog, the prince of Rosh, (Ezek. 32:26) Meshech, and Tubal, and prophesy against him,
and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.

(2 Kin. 19:28; Ezek. 29:4) I will turn you around, put hooks into your jaws, and (Is. 43:17) lead you out, with all your army, horses, and horsemen, (Ezek. 23:12) all splendidly clothed, a great company with bucklers and shields, all of them handling swords.
Persia, Ethiopia, and Libya are with them, all of them with shield and helmet;
(Gen. 10:2) Gomer and all its troops; the house of (Gen. 10:3; Ezek. 27:14) Togarmah from the far north and all its troops—many people are with you.
(Is. 8:9, 10; Jer. 46:3, 4) “Prepare yourself and be ready, you and all your companies that are gathered about you; and be a guard for them.

(Deut. 4:30; Is. 24:22) After many days (Is. 29:6) you will be visited. In the latter years you will come into the land of those brought back from the sword (Ezek. 34:13) and gathered from many people on (Ezek. 36:1, 4) the mountains of Israel, which had long been desolate; they were brought out of the nations, and now all of them (Jer. 23:6; Ezek. 34:25; 39:26) dwell safely.
You will ascend, coming (Is. 28:2) like a storm, covering the (Jer. 4:13) land like a cloud, you and all your troops and many peoples with you.”
